ontology.similarity
Class Hungarian

java.lang.Object
  ontology.similarity.Hungarian

public class Hungarian
extends java.lang.Object

This is an O(n^3) implementation of the the Hungarian algorithm (or Kuhn-Munkres algorithm). Find the maximum cost set of pairings between m x-nodes (workers) and n y-nodes (jobs) such that each worker is assigned to one job and each job has at most one worker assigned. It solves the maximum-weighted bipartite graph matching problem. Caveat: only works if m <= n (i.e., there is at least one job for every worker).

Method Detail

initLabels

private static void initLabels()
Initialize cost labels for x-nodes by setting them to the largest cost on any incident edge (largest value in row). If feasible, this is the optimal solution, otherwise it is an upper bound.

updateLabels

private static void updateLabels()
Update the cost labels for both x-nodes and y-nodes.

addToTree

private static void addToTree(int x,
                              int prevX)
Add new edges to the tree and update slack.

Parameters:
x - current x-node
prevX - previous x-node before x in the alternating path, so we add edges (prevX, xy[x]), (xy[x], x)

findRootSetSlack

private static void findRootSetSlack()
Find a root (an unparied x-node) and compute slack values for y-nodes.

reverseEdges

private static void reverseEdges()
Reverse the edges along the augmenting path starting with edge (x, y).

augment

private static void augment()
A recursive procedure to find augmenting paths to improve the assignments. Terminate when nMatch == maxMatch.

hungarian

public static double hungarian(double[][] _cost)
The main procedure to find initial pairings and then find augmenting paths to improve the pairings/assignments.

Parameters:
_cost - the cost/weight matrix
Returns:
total the total cost

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
The main method used to set up assignment problems.

Parameters:
args - the command-line arguments
